content.description: Wide low angle crack on the left side of the AMC boulder.
content.protection: Large cams from a #5 or #6 depending on how low you want to place your first piece of gear with the crack being widest at the bottom.  #4 Camalot helps a little higher up,#3, #2 and a few smaller pieces as the crack pinches out near the top.
content.location: Large crack, second route to the right

climbs.name: Rurpture
climbs.fa: John Ficker, Ken Akers, and Glen Dickenson, 1981

content.description: Starting the climb would be the crux although i don't think that this is a true 5.10b, the rating seems a little soft, oh well.  Just don't fall after the first bolt before placing your next piece, ground out.
content.protection: 1 bolt, small pro to .75, eyebolt/backup bolt belay.
content.location: Start onto thin face 6 feet right of varicose, rappel off east side.

content.description: Start on left leaning crack on the north face of AMC boulder.  Continue up crack to meet the overhanging crux of Mickey Mantle.
content.protection: Medium to small cams.  One bolt. Maybe a sling for the horn.  A bit of a run out on easy terrain after the bolt.

content.description: Climb thin face just right of Rurpture past bolt. Move right along wide crack to point with over hang(crux) climb past one more bolt to top.
content.location: Right of Rurpture, start on thin face and move right to overhang.

content.description: Thin granite face climbing up the obvious black streak running down the face.
content.protection: 2 bolts on the face, one bolt on top of slab (can be kind of hard to find). Sling tree with a long runner as backup or alternative to top anchor bolt.
content.location: This routes top is at the bottom of the AMC Boulder. Directly below Mickey Mantle (a bit north). Very easy to set up for TR.

content.description:
Reunion is located on the crystal covered face just left of the Varicose crack. You can start from the ground in the middle of the face (harder) or start on the arete to the left, moving up and right to the first bolt. 

  The route is pretty runout, and has only two bolts, the first of which is quite a ways off the ground. If you choose lead this, be very careful and don't fall! As mentioned in the comments below, you can always traverse to the right and put something in to the Varicose crack to lighten up the runout.
content.protection: Two bolts, big eyebolt and couple of glue-ins up on top.
content.location: The route is located on the south face of the AMC Boulder, about 10 feet left of Varicose (big fat crack).

content.description: This route has been stripped of its boltsn they have now been replaced.  Lead turned into toprope problem
Climb past two bolts on face with good feet.  Not a very fun route in my opinion.
content.location: Behind AMC Boulder, route on left of Look Sharp.

content.description: The AMC Boulder, named for the Arizona Mountaineering Club, is the second formation reached on the main climber's trail that heads up to the peak itself. The most obvious feature is the big overlapping flake of the route, Varicose, on the southern side. There are a number of good routes here and eyebolts for belaying and rappelling on the summit.
